name: Mabel Chacko
title: Co-founder & COO
persona_summary: As Founder & CEO, this executive owns both product strategy and commercial outcomes. At a bootstrapped fintech operating in a margin-sensitive category, they are acutely focused on pricing strategy, competitive positioning, and unit economics as they scale without external capital to absorb mistakes.
context_hook: Bootstrapped fintechs live and die by pricing discipline. Competitive benchmarking and real-time pricing intelligence directly impact their ability to acquire and retain customers without burning cash.
personalization_themes: Maintaining competitive pricing edge without a large analytics team | Using data to defend margins as larger funded competitors undercut on price | Automating market intelligence that currently requires manual effort
validation_notes: Output doesn't reference contact's company or role — too generic
li_connect_msg: Hi Mabel, spotted you on the TechSparks speaker list — your work at Open Financial Technologies on maintaining competitive pricing edge without a large analytics team caught my attention. Would love to connect ahead of the event. — Rohan Mehta
during_event_dm:
Hey Mabel,

Great connecting — your work at Open Financial Technologies is interesting, particularly around maintaining competitive pricing edge without a large analytics team.

Bootstrapped fintechs live and die by pricing discipline. Competitive benchmarking and real-time pricing intelligence directly impact their ability to acquire and retain customers without burning cash.

Not pitching anything — just thought it was directly relevant to what you're navigating. Happy to share what we're seeing across similar companies if useful.

Rohan Mehta
VP of Partnerships
email_subject: Something relevant from TechSparks week — Mabel
email_body:
Hi Mabel,

Hope the TechSparks energy has carried into this week.

I've been thinking about something relevant to Open Financial Technologies — maintaining competitive pricing edge without a large analytics team. It's a pattern we keep seeing with founders at your stage: the commercial intelligence work that should be informing pricing and competitive positioning is either delayed, manual, or not happening at the frequency needed.

Bootstrapped fintechs live and die by pricing discipline. Competitive benchmarking and real-time pricing intelligence directly impact their ability to acquire and retain customers without burning cash.

The companies getting ahead of this are using automated data pipelines to do in real-time what used to take an analyst a week — monitoring competitor pricing, tracking assortment gaps, benchmarking before board reviews.

If any of this resonates, I can introduce you to a YC-backed company that specializes in exactly this. They work with several Indian founders in your category and the conversation is worth 20 minutes.

Worth a quick intro?

Rohan Mehta
VP of Partnerships
rohan@company.co
routing_notes: ICP 5 + C-Suite — leadership must approve before send

persona_summary: As Founder & CEO, this executive owns both product strategy and commercial outcomes. At a bootstrapped fintech operating in a margin-sensitive category, they are acutely focused on pricing strategy, competitive positioning, and unit economics as they scale without external capital to absorb mistakes.
context_hook: Bootstrapped fintechs live and die by pricing discipline. Competitive benchmarking and real-time pricing intelligence directly impact their ability to acquire and retain customers without burning cash.
personalization_themes: Maintaining competitive pricing edge without a large analytics team | Using data to defend margins as larger funded competitors undercut on price | Automating market intelligence that currently requires manual effort
validation_notes: Output doesn't reference contact's company or role — too generic
li_connect_msg: Hi Sneha, spotted you on the TechSparks speaker list — your work at NeoBank One on maintaining competitive pricing edge without a large analytics team caught my attention. Would love to connect ahead of the event. — Rohan Mehta
during_event_dm:
Hey Sneha,

Great connecting — your work at NeoBank One is interesting, particularly around maintaining competitive pricing edge without a large analytics team.

Bootstrapped fintechs live and die by pricing discipline. Competitive benchmarking and real-time pricing intelligence directly impact their ability to acquire and retain customers without burning cash.

Not pitching anything — just thought it was directly relevant to what you're navigating. Happy to share what we're seeing across similar companies if useful.

Rohan Mehta
VP of Partnerships
email_subject: Something relevant from TechSparks week — Sneha
email_body:
Hi Sneha,

Hope the TechSparks energy has carried into this week.

I've been thinking about something relevant to NeoBank One — maintaining competitive pricing edge without a large analytics team. It's a pattern we keep seeing with founders at your stage: the commercial intelligence work that should be informing pricing and competitive positioning is either delayed, manual, or not happening at the frequency needed.

Bootstrapped fintechs live and die by pricing discipline. Competitive benchmarking and real-time pricing intelligence directly impact their ability to acquire and retain customers without burning cash.

The companies getting ahead of this are using automated data pipelines to do in real-time what used to take an analyst a week — monitoring competitor pricing, tracking assortment gaps, benchmarking before board reviews.

If any of this resonates, I can introduce you to a YC-backed company that specializes in exactly this. They work with several Indian founders in your category and the conversation is worth 20 minutes.

Worth a quick intro?

Rohan Mehta
VP of Partnerships
rohan@company.co
routing_notes: ICP 5 + C-Suite — leadership must approve before send

Hope the TechSparks energy has carried into this week.

I've been thinking about something relevant to Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) — maintaining competitive pricing edge without a large analytics team. It's a pattern we keep seeing with founders at your stage: the commercial intelligence work that should be informing pricing and competitive positioning is either delayed, manual, or not happening at the frequency needed.

Bootstrapped fintechs live and die by pricing discipline. Competitive benchmarking and real-time pricing intelligence directly impact their ability to acquire and retain customers without burning cash.

The companies getting ahead of this are using automated data pipelines to do in real-time what used to take an analyst a week — monitoring competitor pricing, tracking assortment gaps, benchmarking before board reviews.

If any of this resonates, I can introduce you to a YC-backed company that specializes in exactly this. They work with several Indian founders in your category and the conversation is worth 20 minutes.

Worth a quick intro?

Rohan Mehta
VP of Partnerships
rohan@company.co

At a bootstrapped fintech operating in a margin-sensitive category, they are acutely focused on pricing strategy, competitive positioning, and unit economics as they scale without external capital to absorb mistakes.
context_hook: Bootstrapped fintechs live and die by pricing discipline. Competitive benchmarking and real-time pricing intelligence directly impact their ability to acquire and retain customers without burning cash.
personalization_themes: Maintaining competitive pricing edge without a large analytics team | Using data to defend margins as larger funded competitors undercut on price | Automating market intelligence that currently requires manual effort
li_connect_msg: Hi Beas, spotted you on the TechSparks speaker list — your work at Next Education on maintaining competitive pricing edge without a large analytics team caught my attention. Would love to connect ahead of the event. — Rohan Mehta
during_event_dm:
Hey Beas,

Great connecting — your work at Next Education is interesting, particularly around maintaining competitive pricing edge without a large analytics team.

Bootstrapped fintechs live and die by pricing discipline. Competitive benchmarking and real-time pricing intelligence directly impact their ability to acquire and retain customers without burning cash.

Not pitching anything — just thought it was directly relevant to what you're navigating. Happy to share what we're seeing across similar companies if useful.

Rohan Mehta
VP of Partnerships
email_subject: Something relevant from TechSparks week — Beas
email_body:
Hi Beas,

Hope the TechSparks energy has carried into this week.

I've been thinking about something relevant to Next Education — maintaining competitive pricing edge without a large analytics team. It's a pattern we keep seeing with founders at your stage: the commercial intelligence work that should be informing pricing and competitive positioning is either delayed, manual, or not happening at the frequency needed.

Bootstrapped fintechs live and die by pricing discipline. Competitive benchmarking and real-time pricing intelligence directly impact their ability to acquire and retain customers without burning cash.

The companies getting ahead of this are using automated data pipelines to do in real-time what used to take an analyst a week — monitoring competitor pricing, tracking assortment gaps, benchmarking before board reviews.

If any of this resonates, I can introduce you to a YC-backed company that specializes in exactly this. They work with several Indian founders in your category and the conversation is worth 20 minutes.

Worth a quick intro?

Rohan Mehta
VP of Partnerships
rohan@company.co

name: Mohit Bhatnagar
title: Managing Director
persona_summary: As a Managing Partner at a growth-stage VC, this investor sits on boards of 8–12 portfolio companies across fintech and SaaS. Their operational value-add often includes connecting portfolio founders with tools that improve commercial performance.
context_hook: Portfolio companies in competitive consumer categories frequently lack systematic pricing intelligence. A VC champion who surfaces this capability to their founders creates direct value for their fund's returns.
personalization_themes: Portfolio value creation through better pricing and competitive benchmarking tools | Early-stage portfolio companies need affordable data automation before they can hire analysts | Warm intro pathway: VC introduces product to 5–10 relevant portfolio founders

during_event_dm:
Hey Mohit,

Portfolio companies in competitive consumer categories frequently lack systematic pricing intelligence. A VC champion who surfaces this capability to their founders creates direct value for their fund's returns.

Rohan Mehta
VP of Partnerships
email_subject: Post-TechSparks — one thing worth passing to your portfolio

Portfolio companies in competitive consumer categories frequently lack systematic pricing intelligence. A VC champion who surfaces this capability to their founders creates direct value for their fund's returns.

At a bootstrapped fintech operating in a margin-sensitive category, they are acutely focused on pricing strategy, competitive positioning, and unit economics as they scale without external capital to absorb mistakes.
context_hook: Bootstrapped fintechs live and die by pricing discipline. Competitive benchmarking and real-time pricing intelligence directly impact their ability to acquire and retain customers without burning cash.
personalization_themes: Maintaining competitive pricing edge without a large analytics team | Using data to defend margins as larger funded competitors undercut on price | Automating market intelligence that currently requires manual effort

li_connect_msg: Hi Pawan, attending TechSparks next week and noticed your background at Hero Vired. Working on problems around maintaining competitive pricing edge without a large analytics team — would love to connect. — Arjun Sharma
during_event_dm:
Hey Pawan,

Good to connect at TechSparks. Quick question — is maintaining competitive pricing edge without a large analytics team something your team is actively working through right now? We've been talking to a few people here with the same challenge.

Arjun Sharma
